definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Being attacked on all sides, Rome had to call back her armies to protect what was left of the empire.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬四面受敵，只得調遣軍隊來保衛帝國僅存的部分。

sentences.english: Guests have access to a 24-hour butler and a Rolls-Royce on standby ($5,897; hongkong.peninsula.com ).
sentences.chinese: 有24小時隨時待命的男管家和勞斯萊斯供客人調遣。

sentences.english: US troops line up to storm a house.
sentences.chinese: 美軍調遣部隊襲擊了一所房屋。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to evaluate the merit of sth
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
to deliver a punishing attack/to deal a heavy blow
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
